title: Our inspiration, Thelma A. Meyer, talks about “Perfection”
description: Thelma A. Meyer, the inspiration and namesake behind the Mrs. Meyer’s brand, shares her thoughts on challenging the idea of perfection, the importance of not giving up, and encourages everyone to “just keep making” in this handcrafted short film. To find out more visit our website and remember if what you make doesn’t turn out perfect, perfect. The fun is in the making. We also think it’s in the cleaning but that’s kind of our thing. Share your perfectly imperfect creations with #MakeAndTell.

asset.author: Mrs. Meyer's Clean Day
asset.description:

transcripts: perfection is boring sometimes when you sew up something it doesn't look like you wanted to do turn around and try it again every day I do embroidery and maybe three times a week I play bridge I've been playing for 60 years and I'm still learning something I don't look at my neighbors to see what they're doing I just do my own thing I try to keep it as best I can but not perfect because it can drive you crazy you know being a perfectionist I remember this story the house was kind of disarray and I said help me clean this out and my one son said mom this looks lived-in we have to have our houses lived in I love to cook well I got somebody eat it I like putting things together making them I like planting and then watching it grow I cook everything from scratch so I love that stuff that comes from a garden oh yeah everything doesn't turn out like you think its going to you gotta keep trying keep improving keep at it and don't give up the ship just keep making you
